title: January 20
description: Video of the week: Milo's performance at his very first recital. It's a guitar duo with his teacher Ernie Mansfield.

children.title: Puppies
children.description:
The Chinese claim we're entering the year of the Snake, but 2013 will be the year of the Dog for the Moses family: we're getting a puppy!

Can you believe it? We're looking forward to it with foolish delight and completely irrational optimism.

We have the puppy all picked out. It's a girl, a pure-bred black lab. She's too young to come and live with us; for now, she is staying with her brothers, her sisters and her mama Debbie at their kennel in Oregon. The breeder, Thornwood Labradors, is supposed to be one of the most reputable. They are sending us puppy updates and photos once a week.

So, ONE of those puppies in the picture will be ours, but we don't know which.

We'll get her towards the end of February.

Our tentative name for the precious four legged furball: Higgs Boson. Come, Higgsy!

children.title: Playground
children.description:
Once again, Lucie is on the school's yearbook team.

This week she harvested photos to design the pages for both Felix's and Milo's classes.

children.title: Classmates
children.description: Classmates and D&D mates: Peter, Felix, Holden and Callum.

children.title: Friends
children.description: Felix and Holden have become very good friends in the last month or so. They've had several playdates and sleepovers. It helps that Holden lives just a few blocks from us.

children.title: Thibaud
children.description: Classmates and buddies: Thibaud and Milo.

children.title: Math Rally
children.description: Thibaud and Milo are teammates in the 3rd grade's Math Rally. According to Milo, they are one of the best teams.

children.title: GP Day
children.description: This photo was taken by Milo's teacher back in late November on "Grandparents' Day".

children.title: Passport
children.description:
Lucie took this photo for Felix's new passport.

Last month, a few hours before boarded our flight to Canada, we realized Felix's passport had expired. Oops!

Felix managed to enter Canada on his French passport but we had to regularize the situation in order to be able to come back into the United States.

We went to the American Embassy in Vancouver, where Felix was issued a temporary passport and the kids got a first hand education in bureaucracy.

Now that we are back home, we have to apply for the real deal.

children.title: Steam
children.description:
Milo is down with the flu.

A little hot steam helps clear the nose and chest.

Felix and Lucie are feeling grateful they got their flu shots in the fall. Dean is keeping his fingers crossed. It's hard to avoid contamination when a feverish Milo slips into our bed in the middle of the night and coughs up phlegm onto our pillows.

children.title: Sicky Poo
children.description: It started Thursday night. Milo stayed home Friday, and it got worse Saturday:  fever, chills, congestion and feeling run down all over. He was much better on Sunday. He is still our little sicky poo, though. He has less energy than usual.

children.title: UCPD
children.description:
Last weekend, Milo's scout den visited the police station attached to the UC Berkeley campus.

The kids were curious about all the stuff on a police officer's belt. Every item was patiently displayed: gun, handcuffs, pepper spray, baton, radio, ammo, more handcuffs...

children.title: Jail
children.description: How many cub scouts can you fit in a jail cell?

This is the dispatch center where 911 calls go to. There were also live video feeds of various cameras set around campus.

The police station we visited is responsible for the UC campus and its adjacent neighborhoods.

children.title: Group
children.description:
Everyone at the station was delighted to have kids taking a tour. 'We like kids to have a positive view of us" confided one sergeant.

The tour was organized thanks to Marco's dad, who is friends with the station's chief.

children.title: Bomb Robot
children.description:
This station is home to one of the very few bomb units in the bay area.

Unfortunately, the bomb-sniffing dog was out that day (we learned it is a labrador retriever!!!) but we did get to see the bomb robot. This remote-controlled robot is used to pick up bombs or suspicious packages from a safe distance.

children.title: Bomb Suit
children.description: Quick mom, take the photo! This bomb suit is much heavier than Milo himself.
